topics.body: What the hell does "based" mean? I've seen it been thrown around a few times on the forums, but my investigations into its meaning have been fruitless.
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

topics.body:
"@Silent_Witness":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b08af96368723a607d0a00#post_54b08af96368723a607d0a00

It means something that uses it's main source from another work or that draws elements from something else to create something for a different medium.

i.e. The lord of the rings movies are based on the J.R.R. Tolkien books of the same name
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b090f46368723d76081700#post_54b090f46368723d76081700

the problem is everyone is so fucking negative

"oh we suck" "oh we always lose" "oh you all suck"

nobody is terrible on itself, but they spend more time complaining and claiming they are carrying people than actually following a plan

hell i was telling everyone on wave 3 that we badly needed an engie, but nobody listened

i go engie and bam we win

i tell everyone brb

i come back and everyone leaves me

when i ask particle, she tell me "oh its because spider-byte (kym member) left, and he was doing ALLL THE WORK ON THE TEAM so we basically were gonna los"

nothing makes me madder than people who have potential being so negative
